results.title: Repairing an upholstered chair
results.creator_credit: Topical Film Company and Brent Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Repairs in the Home”.
A practical demonstration of how to mend an upholstered armchair when the seat is sagging or collapsed. A series of shots show the successive stages of building up the armchair on its wooden frame. Following this, a man is seen examining the seat of an armchair that needs repair. Work is started on the inverted chair, removing canvas and old webbing, refastening the springs, replacing the old webbing and stitching the springs to the new webbing, finally replacing the canvas cover. All stages of the operation are shown and explained.

results.title: Repairing a window pane
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Repairs in the Home”.
A practical demonstration of replacing a broken window pane. The film shows the tools required for the job and the whole process in order of procedure, taking out the sash of an upstairs window, measuring the pane, removing the old putty from the rebate and painting the bare wood exposed and fixing the new glass with putty.

results.title: Repairing a sashcord
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Repairs in the Home”.
A practical demonstration of replacing a broken sashcord. An introductory sequence explains the difference between casement and sliding sash windows. A working model shows the structure of the latter. A man is seen in an upstairs room at work renewing a broken sashcord. Each stage of the job is illustrated in detail. Finally the film shows the tools which were used and summarises the method.

results.title: The Wheatlands of East Anglia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Regional Geography”.
The first part of this film deals with the conditions which make East Anglia a good wheat-growing area, and shows both large-scale and small-scale methods of wheat-growing in England, the second part of the film deals with marketing and distribution.

results.title: Lancashire
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Regional Geography”.
Traces the rise of industrial Lancashire, and notes the importance of the coastal ports in the growth of new industries. Also deals with Lancashire’s agriculture, recreation and housing.

results.title: The Fenlands
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Regional Geography”.
The Fenlands situated in Eastern England are one of the flattest regions of Britain. The Fenland landscape is almost wholly manmade, being the result of draining the land, to make it available for agriculture. The danger of flooding is ever present, and in 1947 a disastrous flood occurred. In an attempt to overcome the problem, an extensive sluice system has been devised.

results.title: Adjusting and checking expansion valve
results.creator_credit: Frederick K Rockett and United States. Office of Education
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Refrigeration Service”.
Design and operation of the bellows type and the diaphragm type automatic expansion valves, and how to adjust, check and service the bellows type valve.

results.title: Adjusting and repairing the thermo expansion valve
results.creator_credit: Frederick K Rockett and Anson Bond Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Refrigeration Service”.
Explains the theory of multiple commercial refrigeration systems, how to test and adjust the thermo-expansion valve, recognize symptoms of trouble with the valve and repair it.
